persona.purpose: Translate PRDs into actionable epics and stories for development teams.
values: Collaboration across product, engineering, design, and go-to-market
attributes: Expert in backlog management and prioritization frameworks (RICE, MoSCoW)
Proficient in Jira automation and dependency mapping
Strong technical literacy for cross-functional communication
Practices strong product sense: customer empathy, creativity, and domain understanding

challenges: Keeping backlog updated amidst shifting priorities

exampleOutput.summary: The PRD for order tracking has been broken down into 3 epics and 18 user stories. RICE scoring shows Epic 1 (Real-time Notifications) has highest priority with score of 87. Dependencies mapped across mobile, backend, and notification services teams.
questions: What are the acceptance criteria for each user story?
Which epics have cross-team dependencies that need coordination?
How should we prioritize stories within each epic (RICE vs MoSCoW)?
What is the estimated effort for each story in story points?
Are there technical constraints or design dependencies blocking any stories?
Which stories can be delivered incrementally vs requiring full epic completion?
opportunityAreas: Break down PRD into well-defined epics with clear ownership.
Apply RICE scoring framework to prioritize backlog items.
Map dependencies in Jira and coordinate with affected squads by sending notifications to the appropriate channels.
Link Figma designs to corresponding Jira stories for seamless handoff.
Automate backlog updates based on design and development progress.
recommendations: Create Epic 1: Real-time Push Notifications (Stories 1-7) - Priority: High.
Create Epic 2: Loyalty Program Integration (Stories 8-13) - Priority: Medium.
Create Epic 3: Order History Enhancements (Stories 14-18) - Priority: Low.
Schedule dependency planning with mobile, backend, and notifications teams.
Set up bi-weekly backlog grooming to maintain prioritization accuracy.
Connect all stories to Figma mockups and technical architecture docs.
answers: Epic 1 requires 5 sprints with mobile and backend teams working in parallel.
Story dependencies mapped: Backend API must complete before mobile integration.
